title: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. stock indexes rose, with the S&P 500 gaining 0.62% to close the session at a record and the Dow and Nasdaq adding 0.55% and 0.85%, respectively.

---

Intel apologized following a social-media backlash in China over a letter it sent suppliers asking them to avoid sourcing from the Chinese region of Xinjiang.

---

Amazon reached a settlement with the National Labor Relations Board to make it easier for its employees to organize at work.

---

United is canceling dozens of flights over the holiday weekend as a surge of Covid-19 cases impacted crews, while Delta cited the variant as one factor behind a number of cancellations.

---

Tesla is disabling a feature that allowed people to play games on a front touch screen while driving, according to NHTSA.

---

An industrial accident at an Exxon Mobil plant in Baytown, Texas, injured several people, law-enforcement officials said.

---

Citigroup agreed to sell its consumer-banking business in the Philippines, part of its strategy to exit most of its retail operations in Asia.
